hero.slogan: Londoño Fajardo & Associates, legal advice with purpose
hero.intro: We are a modern law firm focused on trust, rigor, and clear results. Our team combines legal precision with practical experience to protect and enhance your assets and ideas.

consultingPage.title: Legal Consulting & Litigation
consultingPage.intro: We support companies and individuals with clear, results-oriented legal solutions.

items.title: Civil & Commercial
bullets: Analysis, drafting, and negotiation of contracts
Business structuring; civil and commercial agreements
Unfair competition and competition promotion

items.title: Corporate Law & Governance
bullets: Incorporation, reforms, transformation, and liquidation of companies
Mergers, spin-offs, and acquisitions
Capital increases and reductions
Corporate governance: diagnosis and best-practice implementation
Codes of ethics and good governance
Shareholders’ agreements and protocols; related instruments
Due diligence
Corporate secretariat for shareholders and boards; advice to management bodies
Rules for share placements, successive subscriptions, and bond issuances
Securities registration and public offerings
Restructuring, reorganization, and insolvency proceedings; bankruptcy-like processes
Filings before the Superintendence of Companies and Chambers of Commerce
Sagrilaft

items.title: Domestic & Foreign Investment
bullets: Implementation of investment vehicles (trusts, companies, domestic/international tools)
Foreign investment filings with competent authorities
Representation of foreign individuals and entities

items.title: Administrative Contracting
bullets: Advice on bids and tenders; negotiation and drafting of agreements
Support in the pre-contractual phase and public procurement
Administrative and governmental proceedings
Consortia and temporary unions
Right-to-petition filings
Proceedings before the administrative courts

items.title: Labor & Employment
bullets: Employment consulting, opinions, and contracts
Workplace rules and occupational health & safety
Proceedings before the Ministry of Labor (hearings and settlements)
Occupational health programs
Disciplinary proceedings
Review of payroll/benefits liquidation
Separation processes

items.title: Litigation, Arbitration & ADR
bullets: Cases before ordinary and administrative courts
Contractual and tort liability (civil and State)
Unfair competition and competition advocacy
Restrictive trade practices
IP and copyright protection
Conciliation and arbitration
Constitutional and collective actions

propertyPage.title: Industrial Property
propertyPage.intro: We protect and leverage your intangible assets with strategy and precise execution.
bullets: Protection of trademarks, trade names, trade dress, advertising slogans, and appellations of origin.
Clearance searches and registrability analysis for signs.
Protection of new creations (patents, utility models, industrial designs, and others).
Industrial property consulting, drafting of related agreements and contracts.
Recordals of assignments, transfers, name and domicile changes.
Licensing and commercialization agreements.
Copyright registration and protection.
Plant variety protection.
Health/sanitary registrations across modalities.

structuringPage.title: Wealth Structuring & Real Estate Projects
structuringPage.intro: We design and implement robust legal structures for families and real estate ventures.
bullets: Advisory: Specialized contractual and administrative advisory for developers and vis-à-vis supervisory authorities.
Implementation of trust and corporate vehicles for project development.
Legal and economic structuring of real estate projects.
Development and implementation of family strategies and protocols.
Structuring of family and business wealth via trusts, companies, and other mechanisms.
Diagnostics of companies and family wealth.
Due diligence.
Design and structuring of succession plans.
Guarantees — Secured transactions (movable guarantees).

footer.rights: © {{year}} Londoño Fajardo & Asociados. All rights reserved.

aboutPage.title: Our Firm
aboutPage.intro: Londoño, Fajardo & Asociados S.A.S. is a law firm established in Bogotá, D.C., Colombia, since 1999, affiliated with the Colombian–Spanish Chamber of Commerce. We specialize in Corporate Legal Consulting, Industrial Property, Litigation, and Wealth & Real Estate Project Structuring, with correspondents across the Andean Pact countries, South, Central, and North America, and Europe.
aboutPage.indicator: Hover or click each area to view details.

partners.name: Sergio Fajardo Maldonado
details: 30 years of experience in Law
Fellow of the Chartered Institute of Arbitrators (FCIArb)
Founding partner and legal representative of Londoño Fajardo & Asociados S.A.S.
Juris Doctor (Universidad de La Sabana)
Second Level Master’s in International Commercial Law (Sapienza Università di Roma).
Master of Law with emphasis in Contractual and Non-contractual Liability (Universidad Externado de Colombia).
Postgraduate in Negotiation and International Relations (Universidad de los Andes)
PADE at INALDE
Complementary studies at Yale
Registered arbitrator at the Bogotá Chamber of Commerce
Member of the Colombian Society of Engineers dispute-resolution line
Arbitrator at the Superintendence of Companies
President of the Association of Commissioners of the Colombian Mercantile Exchange
Member of ANA’s National Disciplinary Body of Appraisers
Legal representative of construction companies and board member of commercial companies (e.g., Finanzauto S.A.).
Expert in estate planning, corporate counsel, and ordinary/arbitration litigation; led teams structuring public/private, national/international deals.
Training in business structuring, productivity and fundraising (International School of Fundraising, London).
Speaker, consultant and university professor (undergraduate and graduate). Research lines: torts, reparation, corporate and antitrust law.
Former President of the Disciplinary Chamber of the Colombian Mercantile Exchange; member of the Surveillance Committee (2008–2014) and Arbitration Chamber (2015–2017).
Legal adviser to Extebandes (now Standard Chartered Bank Colombia) and Fidubandes S.A.; experience at top Bogotá firms (Palacios Lleras; Leal Angarita & Asociados).

partners.name: María Patricia Londoño
details: 30+ years of experience; businesswoman and founding partner of Londoño, Fajardo & Asociados S.A.S.
Lawyer (Universidad Externado de Colombia); Second Level Master’s in International Commercial Law (Sapienza University of Rome).
Specializations in Financial Law (Colegio Mayor del Rosario) and Corporate Law (Pontificia Universidad Javeriana); Diploma in Company Valuation.
Arbitrator at the Bogotá Chamber of Commerce; member of the Colombian Society of Engineers; arbitrator at the Superintendence of Companies.
Served as legal expert and arbitration secretary in World Bank-cofinanced proceedings (SCI Arbitration & Conciliation Center).
Focus on corporate/business consulting, industrial property, and structuring of projects and estates.
Participation in national and international negotiations; structuring of real-estate investment companies and estates (> COP 100 billion).
Civil/commercial consulting for companies with assets > COP 20 billion; franchise structuring and industrial property proceedings with 90% effectiveness.
Representation of multinationals from India, Germany, the United States and Spain doing business in Colombia.
Courses in business management, productivity and fundraising (International School of Fundraising, The Leadership Institute, London).
Lecturer, consultant, and university professor (undergraduate) in corporate law, industrial property and labor law.

allies.name: Ramón Madriñán Rivera
details: Lawyer with a specialization in Insurance Law (Pontificia Universidad Javeriana).
LL.M. from Harvard Law School; visiting researcher.
Former Director of Regulation at the Ministry of Industry & Tourism (Colombia) — economic/commercial policy and international negotiations.
Expertise in product regulation, commercial practice, and international law; projects across Latin America and the Caribbean.
Professor at the Javeriana and Externado universities (economic law).
Author of books and articles on consumer law and product regulation.

allies.name: Álvaro Camacho Montoya
details: Lawyer from Universidad del Rosario; specialization in Tax Law.
Specialized advisor on real estate taxes and local levies.
Graduate professor in tax law (U. del Rosario, U. de los Andes).
Author of books on real estate taxes, betterment levy, and construction taxes.
Author of articles in Legis tax journals and El Tiempo newspaper.

allies.name: Sonia Mendoza Rodríguez
details: Lawyer specialized in Labor Law (Pontificia Universidad Javeriana).
20+ years of experience in labor, social security, and occupational health.
Experience in public, private, and independent practice; counsel and litigator before labor courts.

allies.name: Julieta Abello Polo
details: Lawyer (U. Sergio Arboleda). Specialist and Master in Family Law (U. Javeriana / U. Antonio Nariño).
Independent practice since 2003; bilingual.
Guest lecturer and speaker; author of publications on filiation.
Authored materials for the Judicial Branch and academic works in family law.
